sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"征服，战胜"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: conquer, overcome, overthrow, defeat, beat, subdue
means: conquer ： 侧重战胜和控制。书面用词。
overcome ： 多指战胜或克服非物质的东西，如困难和不良习惯等。语气较弱也可指在斗争或竞争中战胜或压倒对方。
overthrow ： 指彻底击败对手，使其丧失力量和地位。
defeat ： 普通用词，多指在战争、比赛、竞选或辩论中战胜对手，侧重胜利的暂时性。
beat ： 口笔语均可用，可与defeat换用。
subdue ： 正式用词，与conquer同义，但强调失败后的臣服状态；也可用作借喻，表克制、压抑感情、欲望等。

sentence.Network_en: They feared that totalitarians might yet conquer the entire world.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们担心极权主义者会征服整个世界。

sentence.Network_en: They became overheated nationalists, militarists, and they were out to conquer.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们变成了过分狂热的民族主义分子和军国主义分子，并想要征服别国。

sentence.Network_en: I was certain that love was quite enough to conquer our differences.
sentence.Network_cn: 我相信爱足以克服我们的种种差异。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the general sense 'acquire, attain'): from Old French conquerre, based on Latin conquirere 'gain, win', from con- (expressing completion) + quaerere 'seek'

encyclopedia.content: 英音：[,kɔŋkə]美音：[,kɑŋkɚ] 及物动词vt. 1.攻克，攻取 The city was conqueredovernight. 那座城市在夜里被攻克。 2.战胜；克服；征服；成功地登上 I finally conqueredmy fear of heights. 我终于克服了我的惧高心理。 I believe man will conquerthe weather in the near future. 我相信人类在不久的将来将征服天候。 3.赢得锛埞壑冢诘蕊級赞誉 The singer conqueredthe

entry.def: If one country or group of people conquers another, they take complete control of their land.

example.tran: 1936年，墨索里尼攻占了阿比西尼亚。

example.ex: Early in the eleventh century the whole of England was again conquered by the Vikings.
example.tran: 11世纪早期，整个英格兰再次被北欧海盗征服。

entry.def: If you conquer something such as a problem, you succeed in ending it or dealing with it successfully.

example.ex: I was certain that love was quite enough to conquer our differences...
example.tran: 我相信爱足以克服我们的种种差异。

example.ex: He has never conquered his addiction to smoking.

means.word_mean: 1. to put down by force or authority;
2. take possession of by force, as after an invasion;

sentences.sentence: "the invaders seized the land and property of the inhabitants"

auth_sentence.content: If Jesus could conquer death so could others.

stems_affixes.word_buile: quer寻求,询问+y状态→n.&v.质问,疑问,询问

stems_affixes.value_cn: 征服,战胜,占领;克服,破除[坏习惯等]
stems_affixes.word_buile: con全部+quer寻求,询问→全部寻求到→征服

Sentence.sentence: It is a society well worth studying,and its efforts to conquer the gender gap impart a vital lesson—though not the lesson the Swedes had in mind。

sentences.en: When will scientists conquer the stars?
sentences.cn: 科学家什么时候能征服恒星呢?

sentences.en: I conquered my dislike for mathematics.
sentences.cn: 我克服了讨厌数学的毛病。

jushi.english: When will scientists conquer the stars?
jushi.chinese: 科学家什么时候能征服恒星呢?

jushi.english: I conquered my dislike for mathematics.
jushi.chinese: 我克服了讨厌数学的毛病。
